title: Blocked Billboard
statement:
# Blocked Billboard

During the last summer, two billboards were placed along a highway.

## Problem Description

Two rectangular billboards were placed along a highway. A large truck then parked in front of them, blocking some portion of both billboards.

Given the coordinates of the two billboards and the truck, calculate the total visible (unblocked) area of the two billboards.

Each rectangle is specified by its lower-left corner (x1, y1) and upper-right corner (x2, y2).

## Input Format

Three lines, each containing four integers x1, y1, x2, y2.
- Line 1: Billboard 1 coordinates
- Line 2: Billboard 2 coordinates  
- Line 3: Truck coordinates

## Output Format

A single integer representing the total visible area.

## Constraints

- -1000 ≤ x1 < x2 ≤ 1000
- -1000 ≤ y1 < y2 ≤ 1000
